intro: Calystegia reniformis, commonly known as the heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant is a trailing vine that can grow up to several meters in length, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name.
